other_tests.findings: Right atrial diameter of 6.2 cm, right ventricle end-diastolic diameter of 5.1 cm, right ventricle with eccentric hypertrophy and fractional area shortening of 33%.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Continued right-sided heart dilatation at 32 weeks (atrial diameter = 6.3 cm, end-diastolic diameter = 5.4 cm) and a decrease of right ventricular fractional area shortening to 25%.

other_tests.findings: Sinus rhythm, prominent P waves in V1-V6, and partial right bundle branch block.
Reaction time: 3.5-4.0 mm; clot formation time: 2.0-2.5 mm; maximal amplitude: 63-66 mm; clot formation rate: 74-76%; platelet aggregation: 65-86%.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Mild changes post-delivery: reaction time (4.0 mm), clot formation time (2.5 mm), maximal amplitude (66 mm), clot formation rate (76%), and platelet aggregation (unreported).

other_tests.findings: Successfully placed lumbar epidural catheter with adequate analgesia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Epidural catheter remained in situ until 28 hours after insertion.

other_tests.procedure_name: Continuous oxygen and intermittent iloprost inhalations
other_tests.findings: Cardiac output decreased to 5.4 l/min and then ranged between 4.1 and 6.4 l/min. Systemic vascular resistance (SVR) increased from 567 to 1,180 dyn.s-1.cm-5 and pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) increased from 395 to 890 dyn.s-1.cm-5.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initially, systolic PAP (82-95 mmHg) remained below systolic AP; however, later exceeded AP level without clinical consequences.
